result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher J Draper
Current: 129 N 4th Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2016)
Prior: 809 S. 48th Ave Apt #12, Wausau, WI 54401 United States

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:33 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF754, 14CF1054, AND 15CF348. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF754: Ct. 1 (Strangulation and Suffocation/DA Repeater/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Battery/DA Repeater/DA)>>DELETE DA Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA Repeater/DA)>>DELETE DA repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 4 (DC/DA Repeater/DA)>>DELETE DA repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 5 (DC/DA Repeater/DA)>>DELETE DA repeater enhancer. 
In 14CF1054: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF348: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (OAR)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF754: Amended Ct. 2 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Amended Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Amended Ct. 4 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Amended Ct. 5 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE program and follow up; AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; pay restitution of $5910.77 to WI Crime Victims Compensation Panel at a rate of at least $165 per month; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 4 DA surcharges. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked.

Adj: 2:52 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:38 am 
INCLUDES 14CF754, 14CF1054, 15CF348, AND 15CF549. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Date and time was set for plea hearing in all files. 
State notes parties are prepared to go forward with plea/sentencing in 15CF549 and other files are to be addressed at later date as there is a restitution issue in 14CF754. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 14CF754. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed.  Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 

PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING IN 15CF549. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Operating with PAC 4th within 5 yrs)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 3 (IID Tampering/Failure to Install)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (OWI 4th within 5 yrs)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 6 months MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment if def qualifies under jail criteria; $1759 inclusive with 60 days to pay or payment plan; AODA; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 26 months, as is the defendant himself; 26 month dl revocation with admin credit; DNA sample and surcharge. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit. 
COURT remands def into custody. 
COURT signs order for half priced IID. 

Adj: 8:55 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:39 am 
INCLUDES 14CF754, 14CF1054, 15CF549 (previously was 14CM1001), AND 15CF348. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill. 
Date and time was set for plea hearing. 
State notes parties are not prepared to go forward with plea hearing at this time. 
State requests amended complaint be received in 15CF549. No objection. 
Reading of amended complaint waived in 15CF549. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 15CF549 ONLY. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
COURT imposes same bond in 15CF549 as was imposed in 14CM1001. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set future dates. 


Adj: 9:44 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion & Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection (Plaintiff's)
Original Warrant returned from Sheriff's Dept.
Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
